I think you should talk to this person who thinks they're too strong xP

https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360011406072-Non-Op-Illagers

 

I think they're just about right.  They're strong enough to make you need to gear up and prepare, but not so strong that they're just going to beat the crap out of you.
Did you see antvenoms video vhere he shows how with a bow and errow you can kill them in seconds .

No, I don't watch antvenom.  Just because the evokers have a weakness doesn't mean they are too weak.  Pretty much any land based mob is easier to take out using arrows, but arrows take more skill to use and don't give you the looting effect.  Also, not everyone uses a bow and arrow as normal equipment.
Maybe make the evoker and the elder guardian both drop half a totem of undying so you need to defeat both to get one. This would also give the Elder Guardian a unique drop, which it doesn't have yet.
Elder guardians drop wet sponges, don't they?  Also, couldn't you just kill two elder guardians or two evokers to get a totem of undying?
I believe you have confused the words "weak" and "strong"

improve mob AI, so you cant easily make a raid farm. when in a raid farm, it does not matter how strong they are, because they cant hit you. i just made one today, and got 4 totems of undying in hardcore for just slapping them on the feet.
This makes the totem of undying too common. Maybe those from raids should have 10% chance of dropping it. Just to make it a little more rare

This sounds really cool, but I think this extra level of difficulty should be added to a new "extra hard" mode.  Hard mode already has quite a few things to make it harder, from mobs dealing more damage to being more likely to spawn with armor.
that is literally exactly what I was thinking with the new difficulty, I was going to suggest a few of the above are added in hard mode and the rest in a "advanced" difficulty.

Hard mode is still WAY too easy, it almost feels like kindergarten... I like many of your suggestions, and at least one of them has already taken place on Xbox editions. (The Wither) [Im only here for xbox editions] They should add some ACTUAL difficulty, as now it seems like the mobs spawn amounts are based on your weaponry and their enchantmens, which is stupid. The earlygame is unentertainingly easy.
I think this is awesome but it should be a different mode from hard. Insane would probably fit what you have explained the best. Or maybe Buffed. Others could be Expert or Master.

This is a great idea, but i suggest a few tweaks.

1. Villagers are meant to be nice, they shouldn't attack

2. Instead of shooting cobwebs at players, spiders should shoot out "webs" that if it hits the player, they are slowed down.

3. Pigmen should not be aggressive to the player. They were never like that.

4. Zombies and skeletons should not burn in daylight, which adds to the difficulty of the game.

5. 5% of creepers that spawn naturally should be charged.

And with that, we hope to see a new harder (but reasonable) difficulty added into Minecraft.
The concept of a fourth boss is not a bad idea in and of itself, but "wither dragon"? You couldn't pick a more unoriginal name/idea than that.

A) Think up an original name B) You're meant to say why this would help to make the game better, this is not helpful C) Stop asking why not and ask why, just because Microsoft can add a wither dragon to Minecraft doesn't mean they should, It's not a good idea.

Yes, A soul dragon a wither skeleton will ride it . It won't look like an ender dragon  its head will look kind of like a wither boss head but it will have 2 small ears it will curl up  and eyes will turn off when sleeping . And it will be tameable with a diamond .
Yes, YES! Save my parrots my got in the way graveyard is like 28 strong. Riptide 3. Very dangerous.
YES! PLEASE DO THIS! Too many of my pets have died to my sword, and I always hate myself for killing them, even on accident.

A new mob mouse
Down with the mob vote!

Great idea! I think it should have around the same life points as a player. Same thing could be done to the whale shark. I think it should attack shrimp, and swim away when attacked.
The shark will avoid contact with you around a minute when attacked. Also, I think it shoukd be rare (for every 10 dolphins, around 1 basking shark)

Shrimp, on the other hand, may be eaten by cod, and swim really fast. There would be 2 shrimp for every 1 fish (cod, salmon and tropical fish. Puffer fish wouldn't count).

Also, adding shrimp would add the possibility of adding shrimp as a food item! 

Maybe, they could drop from 0 to 1 shrimp. Shrimp could be smelted to have cooked shrimp. In this case, cooking it will be the only way to eat it.

This is a great idea that opens up so many possibilities. For example I think having shrimp makes foods such as tempura shrimp (which could either be made by cooking shrimp directly or instead by combining cooked shrimp, a bucket of water, eggs, and wheat together), if coconuts were to be added coconut shrimp (which could be made by either combining cooked shrimp and a coconut if cooking shrimp turned into tempura shrimp or by combining cooked shrimp, coconuts and bread together if tempura shrimp is either made with other ingredients or not used at all), and if rice were to be added also ebi sushi (which would be made by combining dried kelp, shrimp, and rice together) as a possibility. These ideas along with the friendly sharks would be some very welcomed additions.
Best idea ever
I have an idea for this it if you eat the shrimp raw it will give you the poison effect so you have to cook it just an idea

I thought about this wonderful idea as well! And especially now, when Minecraft Earth being proper gone this might be a great chance for us to have a lovely friend from that game back. The developers also said they will always reconsider ideas from losing mob votes (the 2020 and 2021 ones) if it fits the update, and the Moobloom (alongside a possible small update to the flower forest) fit this update so well!

I really hope they give the Moobloom another chance!

I think the mooblooms would fit both the bitch forests and the flower biomes. I saw on a YouTube video (can‚Äôt remember) but I think mooblooms should spawn with different colours and the different flowers on their back. As long as you CANT pick which flower the moobloom will have, I think finding one of these that, for example, is red, with roses on its back and taking it home to shear it for the flowers and then it grows them back, would be both adorable, makes it sort of a collectible that you want to find, and helps making flower/dye farms! I‚Äôve loved this idea for a while I hope others agree that it would totally fit.

as a moobloom lover i was so sad in the last mob vote that they lost so early on- you can have your opinions about the mobs from that vote but i think that it‚Äôs safe to say that a large portion of people who play minecraft loved these cute flower cows- ill be extremely disappointed if they never get added to the game

They need to be faster and stronger ASAP!

You have my vote for Solution 3

In the meantime, try to get by with datapacks?

There is one on vanillatweaks.net, Its what they use on hermitcraft.

Solution A sounds like the best since it prevents griefing where you don't want griefing to happen. Another thing I think might be good is if enderman only do their block griefing behavior if they're within a certain distance from the player. The thing is unlike other mobs like creeper, where the creeper explosion is caused by the player and the player sees it happen, an enderman could grief you build from 128 block away and you don't notice it happened until much later when the enderman isn't there anymore.

I want the solution C and A at the same time.
I want to let mobgriefing at true but because of endermans, i put it to no...
Thanks for the suggestion !
Another Idea I had in mind is to add a talisman or something to prevent enderman griefing in a certain radious, like the lightning rod for lightnings
I think this would be cool to add!

I think it would be great.
There are pandas and polar bears, why not grizzly bears?
Ducks definitely, seagulls idk really
Maybe seagulls could snatch a food item out of your have if your holding it

Seagulls could have nests, where they drop food if they are not hungry. They could also collect other items and build up ‚Äòcollections‚Äô in their nests. This could be interesting as player could steal items from seagull‚Äôs nests, potentially creating a new scavenging technique. However, seagulls should be neutral mobs and if you attack them or go too close to their nests, they will attack you back, probably not with much damage but with a lot of knock back. 

Nests would be mainly on cliff faces, so being hit by a seagull means you could fall to your doom. Therefore, you have to time your expeditions so the seagulls are away when you try to steal things.
Seagulls could also attack baby turtles.
WE NEED DUCKS!!!! Maybe seagulls
Spawn next to coastal villages a bit more maybe, and annoy villagers if they fly over them constantly.

Seagulls are a unique and dynamic addition that could enhance the Minecraft. Including these birds would not only enrich gameplay but also provide players with new interactions and environmental storytelling elements. Here are three compelling ideas for how seagulls can be effectively integrated into the official game:

Environmental Interactions: Seagulls could be programmed to interact with the game's environments, such as beaches and coastal areas. They could be seen scavenging for food, diving into the water, or flying overhead. This would add a layer of realism to coastal biomes, making them feel more alive and immersive.

Resource Drop Mechanic: The inclusion of seagulls can introduce a new resource mechanic. For instance, players could collect feathers or eggs from nests that the seagulls build in high places (like cliffs or trees near the coast). This could encourage players to explore and build in coastal regions while providing them with unique crafting materials.

Dynamic Events: Seagulls could trigger dynamic environmental events. For example, if too many players fish in a particular area, the seagulls could begin to swarm and steal fish from players or trigger a temporary "overfishing" event that affects the local fish population. This mechanic could create a sense of consequence and encourage sustainable practices among players.
yeah this can be a new boss and it would go well with the new mountains

mini boss and tamed with new block like snow ore

I think snowy mountains simply need a hostile mob, like the iceologer. We don't need a new mini boss in a place severely lacking unique monsters. Snow ore is a bit too much, but could be cool with an explanation of what it really is.

This would be an amazing way to keep the Zombie Pigmen, but in an easter egg kind-of way. I definitely would enjoy this feature!

Maybe one day this will get more votes,but this is a good idea! I LOVE Piglins,but still miss Pigmen,so this is cool!

This would be really cool. I don't know about picking up items though. I don't know how they'd do it. 

I think some of the glow squids would be a bit more skiddish and bolt away from players while others would float slowly towards you curiously. I think that would really add character and intelligence to this mob and definitely make these glow squids seem more valuable and mystical.

Or maybe their lights could turn off suddenly as the player approaches and then swim off in fear. And then if you're still enough, they'll return and slowly begin to glow again. Similar to how ocelots would've slowly approached you after a while if you appear non-threatening.
It will be really cool if they can slowly float towards player if the player holding a light source
This should be a frog variant that grows in jungles

Also when your in the same block as them they give you poison. They should lay eggs in jungle trees and carry tadpoles on there backs to move them like in real life. They also could climb trees. great idea!
I like the idea
And since the jungle don't spawn slimes and fireflies these frogs should attack spiders. It would be a pretty useful mob.
I think when there hitbox overlaps your you get poison and nausea. There should be multiple colors and should give a speckeled frog light when kills magma cubes.
If added they should have a Celeste (Blue) Froglight!
Lmao you made me spill my tea mate
I live on a farm, and no we dont shear chickens for feathers. It's not how it works
Just imagine that horrifying look.
Poor chickens! :(

Sounds nice, but why shear?

Logically, shearing chickens would cause the feathers to break, and that they (probably) couldn't grow them back.
Plucking however, takes the whole feather, which would make it be able to grow back!
https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360068173212-Chickens-Pluckable
I agree, and Devils should be added to nether fortresses and do the same thing if players loot chests there. (They replace monster spawners.
That would actually be quite a nice way to farm ekytras - maybe they could be similar to a golem, able to be summoned with purpur/end stone and a specific mob head.
Please call it a melonhead and maybe use a different block than snow like gravel and it shoots out seeds at enemies.
This is amazing.
Minecraft Earth answered our prayers üôè hopefully they're added to Minecraft as well
Good idea. There does need to more types of golems.
I love this! Melons should have a cute happy carved face too.

As Minecraft Earth is ending, the Melon Golem should be added to the standard game, and with it a new block, the carved melon.

Using the scissors on the side of the melon, we would cut a smiling face in it and get one piece of melon.

Carved Melon, apart from being used to create a Melon Golem, would have decorative functions and could be turned into a Melon Lantern. It would shine fainter than the Pumpkin Lantern, because the only light would come from his eyes.

The Melon Golem has a different face than the Pumpkin Golem, for example it may appear to be wearing sunglasses.
Man this is great maybe you do quests for them and they give you a reward for it

It would be nice to have tamed bats hang on your ceiling, or follow you around like a parrot does. Bats are a core part of Minecraft history and I think every veteran player would love to have their own personal bat companion.
